title-group.article-title: Forbidden Privileges and History-Writing in Medieval India

contrib-group.aff: *King’s India Institute, King’s College London. Email: nilanjansarkar@hotmail.com

abstract.p: This article uses evidence of non-hetero sexual relations in medieval India to examine the art of writing History and the making of Persianate textual archives. It focuses on political and sufi texts, and demonstrates the possibility of recovering a more textured knowledge of history-writing in pre-modern Islamicate India where texts remain the primary source for understanding and recovering histories.
